intro: Sebaea gentilii, commonly known as the velvetleaf or the silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery down. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Sebaea gentilii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display.
